learning_outcomes.description: Apply theoretical techniques to perform a basic musculoskeletal MR examination, with particular reference to liver imaging, enterography, prostate and female pelvis.
Distinguish between normal anatomy and pathologies in MR images
Construct and tailor the examination protocol accordingly
Establish appropriate patient care and understand equipment and patient set up

assessments.due_date:
Quiz 1 should be completed prior to: 5/09/2025 2:00 pm

Quiz 2 should be completed prior to: 17/10/2025 2:00 pm

Quiz 1 is available from Friday 29 August 9:00 (week 5).

Quiz 2 is available from Friday 10 October 9:00 (week 10).
assessments.task_description:
1) Description

Each quiz has 10 Questions for a total of 10 marks.

2) Instructions

Quiz questions are True/False, Multiple Choice, Multiple Answer or Short Answer, and are worth marks according to difficulty.

  • Duration

 The quiz duration is 10 minutes (from the start of the quiz).

The quiz can’t be saved. Once the quiz is started, it must to be completed within 10 minutes. The quiz will be submitted automatically once the time expires.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Your paper should aim to be 2000 words (strictly limited to 1800 - 2200 words)

Referencing

Variation in referencing styles exist in journals relevant to MRI science; therefore, we do not specify a particular style but prefer the use of either the Vancouver or Harvard referencing style. Both styles are attached. Click on the link to get access to ﾠUQ referencing style guides
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
